total_revenue.fx_impact: Revenue would have been approximately $114 million higher at constant FX rates

drivers: Growth from Facebook News Feed, Instagram Stories, and Instagram Feed

payments_and_other_fees.context: Growth driven primarily by Quest 2 holiday sales

north_america.context: Strong performance in US and Canada

rest_of_world.headwinds: Impacted by foreign currency headwinds and challenging macroeconomic conditions

key_factors: $2 billion expense related to FTC settlement
Increased investments in compliance, privacy, product development, and infrastructure

expense_growth_excluding_accrual.note: Without the $2 billion FTC settlement expense

cost_of_revenue.context: Driven primarily by hardware costs related to Quest 2 sales, core infrastructure investments and payments to partners

research_and_development.context: Driven primarily by hiring and investments in core products as well as Facebook Reality Labs

marketing_and_sales.context: Driven by hiring and marketing spend

general_and_administrative.context: Driven primarily by higher legal related expenses

headcount.context: Investments in safety, product innovation, infrastructure, and compliance

net_income.context: Includes impacts from FTC settlement and IRS vs Altera case

eps.impact_of_accrual: EPS increased by $0.31 due to one-time tax benefit

cash_flow.context: Generated from operating activities after capital expenditures

capital_expenditures.context: Investments to support growth and infrastructure needs

share_repurchase.context: Class A common stock repurchased in Q4 2020

repurchase_authorization.context: Remaining from prior authorization as of December 31st

new_authorization.context: Increase in stock repurchase program authorization

facebook_dau.leading_markets: Growth led by India, Indonesia, and the Philippines

daily_active_people_across_apps.context: Average daily active users across Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, and Messenger

monthly_active_people_across_apps.context: Average monthly active users across Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, and Messenger

drivers: Increased impressions on Facebook News Feed, Instagram Stories, and Instagram Feed
Improved pricing in Facebook mobile feed and Instagram Stories

communities.description: Helping people build and participate in meaningful communities by developing community infrastructure beyond feeds and message boards.
initiatives: Building tools to help groups get things done together
Providing support across messaging, video chat, and community websites
Exploring ways to raise funds including donations, merchandise, and membership fees
Removing groups that violate rules against violence or hate
Stopping recommendation of civic and political groups in the U.S. and globally
Reducing political content in News Feed to prevent divisive conversations
impact: Removed more than 1 million groups in the last year
examples: Local bookstores and coffee shops using Instagram for curbside pickup
Groups supporting COVID long-haulers and facilitating remote friendships

private_messaging.description: Enhancing private messaging platforms with a focus on privacy, security, and interoperability across apps.
initiatives: Rolling out updates to Instagram to improve messaging experience
Expanding Reels for short, entertaining videos
Enhancing AR effects with over 400,000 creators
Launching Quest 2 for mainstream VR experience
Partnering with Luxottica to build first smart glasses
Expanding Portal features for workplace collaboration
challenges: Apple’s potential interference with ad targeting and measurement
iOS 14 changes impacting small businesses' ability to reach customers
goals: Develop next computing platform with AR and VR

commerce_tools_for_small_businesses.description: Providing tools and resources to help small businesses transition online, reach customers, and generate revenue.
initiatives: Launching Facebook Shops for storefronts on Facebook and Instagram
Expanding Checkout to all U.S. businesses
Introducing Paid Online Events for live-streaming classes, talks, and events
Enhancing WhatsApp business features with Carts and business messaging tools
Updating WhatsApp’s privacy policy for business messaging
impact: Enabled seamless online sales and customer communication
Helped small businesses reach customers effectively during pandemic
Supported economic opportunities for small businesses
examples: Local bookstores and coffee shops using Instagram for curbside pickup
Carlota Flower Lab's nine times increase in revenue
Redoux's success via BuyBlack Friday campaign

building_next_computing_platform.description: Investing in virtual and augmented reality to build immersive computing platforms for the future.
initiatives: Launching Quest 2, a mainstream VR headset
Building AR glasses in partnership with Luxottica
Expanding Portal's role into workplace collaboration
Developing consumer AR glasses
Investing in Facebook Reality Labs
goals: Create seamless presence with AR glasses
Expand VR usage for gaming, workouts, and remote work
outcomes: Quest 2 launched successfully with strong sales
60 Oculus developers generating millions in revenue
Ray-Ban smart glasses launching next year

ads_transparency.global_rollout: Made available globally for ads about social issues, elections, or politics
benefits: Enhanced defense against foreign interference and abuse

measures: Operation centers established for rapid response
Collaboration with third parties and fact-checking organizations
Expanded Ads Library to include all ads
ID and location verification for EU political/issue ads
'Paid for by' disclosures required in political ads
Proactive identification and removal of foreign interference campaigns from Russia and Iran
Policies to support accurate voting information
outcomes: Positive feedback from EU Parliament officials on clean elections
Advanced systems preventing foreign interference in elections
Largest voting information drive in American history
election_integrity.future_plans: Continued efforts to protect upcoming 2020 U.S. elections

changes: No targeting by age, gender, or zip code
Creation of a new library for housing ads with reporting capabilities
examples: Enhanced ad targeting to prevent discrimination
Improved tools for reporting discriminatory ads

revenue_growth.expectation: Moderate growth driven by strong holiday season and Quest 2 sales
factors: Strong advertiser demand during holiday season
Potential moderation or reversal in economic trends
revenue_growth.specifics: Full year 2020 revenue grew 22% to $86 billion

drivers: Growth in non-headcount related expenses like marketing
Operational savings from reduced travel and events

expense_outlook_excluding_accrual.note: Expense outlook essentially unchanged from last quarter excluding the $2 billion accrual recorded in Q4

capital_expenditures_guidance.reason_for_adjustment: Spend that was delayed from 2020 due to the impact of the pandemic on construction efforts

context: Tax treatment of FTC settlement accrual
IRS vs Altera case ruling affecting share-based compensation expenses

drivers: Growth in non-headcount related expenses like marketing
Operational savings from reduced travel and events

operating_environment_challenges: Regulatory scrutiny due to FTC settlement
Currency headwinds impacting European and Rest of World regions
Balancing privacy enhancements with monetization strategies
Maintaining user trust amidst evolving social and political scrutiny
Impact of COVID-19 pandemic on user behavior and advertising demand
